p: The GC-MS analysis of the EO of C. nubigenum identified 33 constituents accounting for 99.6% of the whole oil. In the EO of L. angustifolia 27 constituents were identified, accounting for 99.2% of the whole oil ( Table 1). The principal chemical constituent of the EO of C. nubigenum was carvacrol (32.9%), followed by pulegone (25.4%), whereas linalool (35.2%) and linalyl acetate (33.4%) were the main compounds in the EO of L. angustifolia. Other important volatiles were p-cymene (9.1%) and iso-menthone (6.4%) for the EO of C. nubigenum, and Î±-pinene and borneol (3.6 and 3.5%, respectively) for the EO of L. angustifolia ( Table 1).
